review: The Fire TV Stick compares favorably to the Roku I have used for years, and I like its capabilities. It has a somewhat different set of "extra" content providers than Roku does, as other reviewers have notged, but most of us are just here for Amazon Prime videos, Netflix, Hulu Plus, and other major content providers.However, my unit has a quirk: every two minutes -- while I am watching TV with the stick plugged in and powered up -- it interrupts the TV signal just for a second.This signal interruption happens every two minutes (timed by a stopwatch) and is replicable . I powered it off and back on, but that did not help it.  And it happens whether or not the stick is in "sleep" mode.I've searched the other reviews, but no one else seems to have reported this issue.I could live with this, but I'll contact Amazon regarding a replacement. I simply wanted to get this issue out there in case others have experienced it.UPDATE: I originally wrote this as a 'power interruption', but that was incorrect.
author: Paul Havemann "umbrage at ambage"
